instruction: Prepare the filling: In a small bowl, combine the shredded imitation crab meat with the mayonnaise. Mix well to combine.
Prepare the rolling station: Cover a bamboo sushi mat with plastic wrap. This will prevent the rice from sticking to the mat.

Assemble the roll: Place half of the nori seaweed sheet on the plastic-wrapped bamboo mat, shiny side down. Spread a thin and even layer of cooked sushi rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top. Dip your fingers in water to prevent sticking as you spread the rice.

Add the filling: Arrange a line of the imitation crab mixture with mayonnaise in the center of the rice, closer to the bottom edge. Add a line of julienned cucumber and sliced avocado next to the crab mixture.

Roll the sushi: Using the bamboo mat as a guide, carefully lift the bottom edge of the mat over the filling. Gently roll the mat forward, applying light pressure to form a tight cylinder. Use the plastic wrap to help you shape the roll and seal the edge.
Shape and cut: Once rolled, remove the bamboo mat and plastic wrap. Moisten a sharp knife with water and cut the roll into 6-8 even pieces.
Garnish (optional): Sprinkle the California roll pieces with white sesame seeds for extra flavor and presentation.
Serve: Enjoy your California roll with wasabi paste and pickled ginger (optional)!
You can adjust the amount of fillings to your preference.
Wetting your fingers with water will prevent the rice from sticking to your hands while spreading.
If you don't have a bamboo sushi mat, you can use a parchment paper sheet instead.
